title: feat: Add simulation_voltage_probe element
description: Adds a simulation_voltage_probe element for voltage measurement in circuit simulations, allowing connections to source ports or nets.
body:
This pull request introduces the simulation_voltage_probe element, which is used to define points in the circuit for       
voltage measurement during simulation. This element can be connected to either a source port or a source net.              

Example usage:                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    
```
<voltageprobe connectsTo="C1.pin1" name="C1_pos" />                                                                        
<voltageprobe connectsTo="net.VOUT" />
```  
 • A new file, src/simulation/simulation_voltage_probe.ts, to define the element's schema and interface.                   
 • A corresponding test file, tests/simulation_voltage_probe.test.ts.                                                      
 • Updates to src/simulation/index.ts and src/any_circuit_element.ts to integrate the new element.                         
 • Regeneration of the documentation to include the new element.

title: feat: Add timing parameters to SimulationExperiment
description: Adds time_per_step, start_time_ms, and end_time_ms to SimulationExperiment to allow for more precise control over simulation timing. These properties are optional.
body:
Adds time_per_step, start_time_ms, and end_time_ms to SimulationExperiment to allow for more precise control over          
simulation timing. These properties are optional.

title: Refactor time into timestamp and duration
description: Refactors the generic time unit into two specific units: timestamp for a specific point in time and duration for a length of time, improving clarity and type-safety throughout the codebase.
body:
This pull request refactors the generic time unit into two more specific units: timestamp and duration.                    

 • timestamp is used to represent a specific point in time.                                                                
 • duration is used to represent a length of time.                                                                         

This change improves clarity and type-safety throughout the codebase. The simulation_switch and                            
simulation_transient_voltage_graph elements, along with their corresponding tests and documentation, have been updated to use these new, more descriptive types.

title: feat(voltageprobe): Make an optional name prop
description: Makes the name prop optional for the voltageprobe  component, allowing usage without a name.
body:
This change makes the name prop optional for the <voltageprobe /> component. This allows for usage like <voltageprobe
connectsTo="net.VOUT" /> in addition to the previous requirement of always supplying a name.                               

A test has been added to verify that the component can be parsed both with and without the name prop.

description: Adds a new test case for spice analysis featuring an RC charging circuit with a voltage divider.
body:
This PR adds a new test case for spice analysis featuring an RC charging       
circuit with a voltage divider.                                                

The new test file, spice-analysis03-rc-charging-voltage-divider.test.tsx,      
defines a circuit containing resistors, a capacitor, and a chip component      
acting as a power source. It runs an analogsimulation and asserts that the     
simulation output is generated, capturing the result in a snapshot.

title: Switch 3D snapshots to circuit-json-to-gltf + poppygl (PNG)
description: Replaces the simple-3d SVG pipeline with GLTF-based rendering, generating 3D snapshots as PNGs using poppygls rasterizer.
body:
• Replace the simple-3d SVG pipeline with GLTF-based rendering:               
    • circuit-json -> circuit-json-to-gltf (GLTF/GLB)                          
    • GLTF/GLB -> PNG via poppygl                                              
 • 3D snapshots are now PNGs, generated headlessly with poppygl’s pure JS      
   rasterizer.    

/claim #1417
/closes #1417

title: Disconnected traces now throws error
description: claim https:github.comtscircuitcoreissues1425 closes https:github.comtscircuitcoreissues1425 The function had if (!sourceTrace) continue which skipped ALL net-level traces (traces with IDs like source_net_1 instead of source_trace_22). This meant disconnected endpoints in net-level traces were never detected. Solution (3 changes): 1. Removed the skip: Deleted if (!sourceTrace) continue so net-level traces are now checked 2. Handle undefined sourceTrace: Changed to const expectedPorts  sourceTrace ? pcbPorts.filter(...) :  and added ?. operators 3. Added floating endpoint check: For net-level traces (with no expectedPorts, check if both endpoints connect to ANY pad. If not, report the disconnected endpoint with coordinates.
body:
/claim https://github.com/tscircuit/core/issues/1425
/closes https://github.com/tscircuit/core/issues/1425

The function had `if (!sourceTrace) continue` which skipped ALL net-level traces (traces with IDs like `source_net_1` instead of `source_trace_22`). This meant disconnected endpoints in net-level traces were never detected.

Solution (3 changes):
1. Removed the skip: Deleted `if (!sourceTrace) continue` so net-level traces are now checked
2. Handle undefined sourceTrace: Changed to `const expectedPorts = sourceTrace ? pcbPorts.filter(...) : []` and added `?.` operators
3. Added floating endpoint check: For net-level traces (with no `expectedPorts`, check if both endpoints connect to ANY pad. If not, report the disconnected endpoint with coordinates.

title: A Better, Cleaner Editor
description: Fixes unexpected scrolling and layout issues in the code editor by implementing a responsive flexbox design that adjusts the editor and preview area to fit the screen perfectly.
body:
Previously, you might have noticed that the page would sometimes scroll unexpectedly, and the different parts of the editor didn't always fit neatly on the screen.

We fixed that!

Now, the code editor and the preview area automatically resize to fill the screen perfectly. No matter the size of your window, the layout will adjust itself to fit, giving you a clean and stable workspace without any weird scrolling.

This makes for a much more pleasant editing experience.

Before
[Screencast from 2025-10-03 10-33-21.webm](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/cffa6a43-d4a9-4f5f-99c9-8489095bdb79)

After
[Screencast from 2025-10-03 10-35-03.webm](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/b70a8793-d1c7-471f-84f4-6314e5c8d196)


In a nutshell
- We removed the footer
- and we made it a flex box! for better area coverage and stopping bad vertical overflows

title: feat: Add automatic .tran command for transient simulations
description: Adds automatic generation of .tran command for transient simulations in SPICE netlist based on simulation_experiment properties.
body:
This pull request introduces a feature to automatically generate a .tran command for the SPICE netlist when a              
simulation_experiment is present in the input circuit JSON.               

This eliminates the need to manually add the transient analysis command to the netlist for time-based simulations.         

 • The circuitJsonToSpice function now detects simulation_experiment elements and creates a corresponding .tran command    
   string based on the time_per_step, start_time_ms, and end_time_ms properties.                                           
 • The SpiceNetlist class has a new tranCommand property to hold this command.                                             
 • The convertSpiceNetlistToString utility now appends the tranCommand to the output SPICE string, but only if a .tran     
   command is not already present.                                                                                         
 • Added a new test file (tests/unit/transient-simulation.test.ts) to verify the new functionality.

title: Add SPICE support for circuit-json simulation switches
description: Add support for voltage-controlled switch components and control sources for simulation_switch entries when converting to SPICE, along with unit and integration tests for square-wave behavior driven by simulation switches.
body:
## Summary
- generate voltage-controlled switch components and control sources for `simulation_switch` entries when converting to SPICE
- add unit and integration coverage for square-wave behavior driven by simulation switches
- bump the `circuit-json` dependency to the latest release

## Testing
- bun test tests/unit/circuit-json-conversion.test.tsx
- bun test tests/integration/simulation.test.ts
- bunx tsc --noEmit

title: feat(docs): Add pinout SVG guide and preview support
description: Add a new guide for generating pinout diagrams and update CircuitPreview to support pinout rendering.
body: This pull request introduces a new guide for the pinout SVG feature and updates the CircuitPreview component to support rendering pinout diagrams. • New Documentation (docs/guides/tscircuit-essentials/pinout-svg.mdx) • Added a new guide to showcase the pinout SVG generation feature, including a code example using a Raspberry Pi Pico W component. • Component Update (src/components/CircuitPreview.tsx) • Added a new pinout view option. • Introduced a showPinoutTab prop to conditionally display the "Pinout" tab. • Updated the background for the pinout view to be white for better contrast and readability. /claim https://github.com/tscircuit/tscircuit/issues/788 /closes https://github.com/tscircuit/tscircuit/issues/788

title: Add caching to high density intranode solvers and expose stats ⭐
description: Add synchronous caching to the high-density intra-node solver with rounded cache keys and cached result application, and update the in-memory cache provider to track hitsmisses by prefix and surface intra-node cache stats from the high-density solver.
body:
⚠️ This is confirmed working


## Summary
- add synchronous caching to the high-density intra-node solver with rounded cache keys and cached result application
- update the in-memory cache provider to track hits/misses by prefix and surface intra-node cache stats from the high-density solver

## Testing
- bunx tsc --noEmit
- bun test tests/bugs/highdensityoverlap1.test.tsx

title: Fix path simplification tail fallback and add regression test
description: Fixes path simplification to ensure fallback to original segment when no 45 path can reach the tail, preserving vias and endpoints, and adds a regression test for bug d3f3be1b.
body:
## Summary
- ensure the simplified path solver falls back to the original segment when no 45° path can reach the tail, preserving vias and end points
- add the downloaded bug report assets and a regression test that exercises bug d3f3be1b with an SVG snapshot and DRC assertion
- verify the regression test asserts the final trace terminates at the expected port location

## Testing

title: feat: Add transient simulation comparison with ngspice
description: Adds a comparison framework for transient analysis between spicey and ngspice, integrating eecircuit-engine for simulations, adding visual snapshot testing, and fixing a parsing bug related to the PULSE() source definition.
body:
This pull request introduces a comparison framework for transient analysis between spicey and ngspice.               

 • Integrates eecircuit-engine to run simulations against ngspice.                                                         
 • Adds bun-match-svg for visual snapshot testing of simulation outputs.                                                   
 • Leverages circuit-to-svg to generate comparison graphs.           
 • A new test case for an RC circuit runs simulations on both engines and plots the results on a single SVG graph for      
   comparison.                                                                                                             
 • Includes data formatting utilities to convert results from both engines into a common SimulationTransientVoltageGraph   
   structure.                                                                                                              
 • Fixes a parsing bug related to the PULSE() source definition.

description: Summary document a modular directory layout in the README for future feature expansion split the SPICE simulator into focused parsing, analysis, formatting, math, stamping, and utility modules with one exported function per file re-export the new modules through libindex.ts to preserve the public API  Testing bunx tsc --noEmit bun test testsbasicsbasics01.test.ts
body:
## Summary
- document a modular directory layout in the README for future feature expansion
- split the SPICE simulator into focused parsing, analysis, formatting, math, stamping, and utility modules with one exported function per file

title: bump jscad-electronics to 0.0.43
description: Updates the jscad-electronics dependency from version 0.0.42 to 0.0.43 and modifies the test to accommodate the new version.

title: fix: Unify symbol library ID generation
description: Fixes broken schematic files caused by mismatched library IDs in symbols, preventing core dumps when opening in KiCad.
body:
ref: https://github.com/tscircuit/circuit-json-to-kicad/issues/8

The program was creating broken schematic files. because the name in the symbol and the library were not the same!
like below
```
(lib_symbols
  ...
  (symbol "Custom:push_button_normally_open_momentary_horz" ... )
)
...........
(symbol
  (lib_id "Device:Component")  // <--- THIS WAS THE PROBLEM
  ...
  (property "Reference" "SW1" ...)
  ...
)
```

after fix
```
(lib_symbols
  ...
  (symbol "Custom:push_button_normally_open_momentary_horz" ... )
)
...........
(symbol
  (lib_id "Custom:push_button_normally_open_momentary_horz")  // <---  CORRECT NAME
  ...
  (property "Reference" "SW1" ...)
  ...
)
```

Because of this, we were getting a core dump when we tried to open Kicad


To test the problem, download the kicad_proj in https://tscircuit.com/editor?package_id=4a6fa81c-98b9-4b15-b1cb-132cfe2ec970&file_path=index.ts and try to open the sch files in Kicad. It will core dump
